column5: http://www.leevalley.com/gifts/page.aspx?c...cat=4,104,58654   How lazy have we become...  G
Gotta love Lee Valley, always catering to the domestic market.  They also have a great sense of humour too.
Pretty lazy, betcha he's sold a bunch already even if they are as gag gifts he's making money.
Thats pretty funny, i guess somebody out there had tired thumbs and thought of a alternative.
So, how many did you order Gerritt?? LOL

I had a roll up the rim moment today. One of the kids in my class showed up after making a Timmyâ€™s run and naturally brought me one. After finishing it, I took off the lid to have a go only to realize that the rim had already been rolled! Oh well, maybe he can get the credit at summer school.
now thats funny..
HaHaHa!!      serves him right

now thats just crazy, but I think lots of people will buy them, gag gift or not, lazy or not. I won 2 yrs. ago, the Coleman Camping package, using my thumbs and fingernails, along with about 12 coffees and cookie/donut freebies. Gave all the Coleman stuff to my nieces and sisters who could use them( I already have stuff like that for my personal use), for free, I would have bought the coffee anyways, regardless of winning.
If you use sanding sticks probably a better deal here  http://www.blackbearcc.com/Tools.htm#x_acto
It's actually a very good idea! A lot of my clients have trouble handling things ( a lot have MS) and would not be able to roll them up.
I have seen one in action, and it works very well.
Well guys it may be not mutch.But it is Canadian and is made in Canada. Way to go guys!
I got one for my step dad for Christmas  He loves it.
I am still pretty happy with my thumbs.
Thats brutal!!!!! But funny in a twisted sense!
I wish I had thought of it. Could take the summer off for the next ten years from the money it would make.
Looks like it would be great for guys like me with arthritic thumbs...  Unrolled a rim last Saturday with difficulty then they said "Try Again"...thanks a helluva much...
am I the only one here they unrolls it with their bottom teeth?? grab is n pull... simple.  G
Gerrit, Im a tooth roller too!!!!  If its from LV, its probably the biggest rip-off going.  I think they have tools to de-claw your cat, they cater to the DIY, lazy, and brainless!
i was gonna say.......i didnt know anyone actually tried rolling it up with their thumbs......Im a bottom teeth guy myself.
<-- bottom teeth guy
Those came out last year and they were selling like hotcakes. they couldn't keep them on the shelves.  For  $2.50 why not encourage the guy that thought of it.
i'm a bottom teeth guy also  i also saw them in the lee valley catalog, last week i saw them for sale at the cash at the zellers in north bay, no i didnt buy one

Teether all the way !!! But I gotta tell yah, I'll be grabbing one for Debbe if I can get one local. She is a Horton's junkie and I know she would get a kick outta it. Besides her key chain weighs about 50LBS already. She wouldn't even notice a difference by sticking that little guy on there.
